column4: I prefer rTorrent because it's console based so I can run it inside screen.
does it have encryption yet?
I think it might have been added in the newest release, but I'm not sure.
no encryption means it's useless crap for me
I've never needed encryption,so I never checked.
it's called manual partitioning and works nice
What I've been asking is how the heck does the manual partitioner work. My friend can't figure it out and the screenshots seem to indicate a design that isn't as manual as it should be.
I could, but then, I'm a geek, and I also knew better and check if it _really_ isn't going to format my existing partitions, which it didn't support (hi again, Reiser4)
I'm a geek too, I just don't have much luck working from screeshots of a machine thousands of kilometres away.
do you have the screenshots somewhere handy?
http://img297.imageshack.us/my.php?image=screenshot1wo8.png
That's where we're stuck.
it should be possible to ssh into a ubuntu installer :)
I'll ask him.
ask him to go into System -> Preferences -> Desktop Sharing
if you can access his machine from outside, it should do the trick
What protocol does that use? I'm on Gentoo.
umm, VNC
Ahh, no problem then. I've got vncviewer installed.
install xvncviever4
still, it's pretty sick you can IM from an installer :)
He says he doesn't have Desktop Sharing.
what about Remote Desktop or somesuch? I'm translating back from Danish, so my names might not be entirely accurate
We figured it out, but it's now saying "No root filesystem" even though we set one.
